awd_titl_txt: Computation Trees and Circuits with Functions of k-Valued   Logic
awd_abstract_narration: This project focuses on the structure of complexity classes that  are  known to lie between the classes P and PSPACE, on the one  hand, and on the  circuit complexity classes, on the other hand.  Many of the well-studied  complexity classes can be specified by  considering computation trees and  circuits with functions of k-  valued logic.   It is of interest to learn the  power of this  method of specification; that is, what classes can or cannot be  characterized this way.  Specifically, while `leaf languages`  have been  successfully used in some settings, it is not known how  broadly they can be  used.  Similarly, the study of the structure  of the Boolean hierarchy or of the  polynomial hierarchy over a  complexity class of partitions may yield approaches  for studying  the Boolean hierarchy on NP or the polynomial-time hierarchy,  respectively.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division of Computing and Communication Foundations
